Dear Harry:
Commenting on Marcus Cohn*s letter to you of April 12
about the Smathers Bill (with carbons to Garnet Garrison and
me), it is my recommendation that we have Marcus request an
opportunity for us to appear. By ’’appear’1 I don*t mean
necessarily that you or I should have to go to Washington to
testify; it might be sufficient if we merely file some sort
of statement with the committee, though of course counsel*s
advice would obtain here.
I also think that we should, as Marcus puts it, ’’neither
support nor oppose the bill, at the hearing, but should merely
ask that the bill be amended so as to exclude licensees who
are educational institutions.”
In view of the fact that the May hearings will probably
come after our Board meeting in Columbus, I don’t think we
need to ask for Board approval now. We can discuss it then,
and if they disavow us, we can withdraw (though I doubt they
would).
Ifpurs sincerely.
